Consolidated_InvoiceObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Consolidated_InvoiceObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Consolidated_InvoiceObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Consolidated_Invoice_Request_References.description: Instance set containing the Consolidated Invoice object.

description: This element content contains the Consolidated Invoice reference element used to return the Consolidated Invoice by unique identifier.

Document_StatusObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Consolidated_Invoice_Request_Criteria.description: Reference to an existing Consolidate invoice Document Status. Examples of Document Statuses are Approved, Canceled, Denied.

Document_Payment_StatusObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Consolidated_Invoice_Request_Criteria.description: Reference to an existing Payment Status. Examples of Payment Statuses are Draft, In Progress, Approved.

Invoice Due Date On or After
Invoice Due Date On or Before

description: This element content contains the wrapper element for the list of criteria representing the Consolidated Invoice specific criteria needed to search for instances.

validation.validation: Invoice Due Date On or After must be earlier than Invoice Due Date On or Before.
validation.description: Invoice Due Date On or After must be earlier than Invoice Due Date On or Before.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

Consolidated_Invoice_Response_Group.description: Flag indicating if the Consolidated Invoice Reference data is to be included in the response.

description: Element content containing Consolidated Invoice Response Group element.
